Problem:
Consider a complex function scenario where \\( z(t) = x(t) + iy(t) \\) represents a signal in the complex plane, evolving over time according to \\( \\dot{z} = Pz \\), with P being a constant matrix. We analyze the effect of a Laplace transformation, defined as \\( \\mathcal{L}(z)(s) = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st}z(t) dt \\), applied at time t = 0.

Given the observed changes in \\( \\mathcal{L}(z)(s) \\) over time, can we determine exactly when the switch from P to Q happened?
Explanation: Identifying the exact switch time from P to Q based solely on changes in \\( \\mathcal{L}(z)(s) \\) is challenging because the transform could obscure subtle differences due to integrating over all future values of z(t). The precise moment of change might not be distinctly marked in the transformed signal.
